bioghist.p: The American Institute of Chemists (AIC), founded in 1923, is a professional association of chemists. The AIC fosters the advancement of the chemical profession through its awards and certification programs, meetings, publications, and public relations activities. New Jersey Institute of Chemists is the local New Jersey branch of the AIC. Homer J. Hall, was a research chemist at Esso (Exxon). He was the national secretary of the AIC and was president of the local New Jersey chapter of the AIC, the New Jersey Institute of Chemists (NJIC). In 1971, Hall was appointed to be the AIC's representative to the American Association for the Advancement of Science (AAAS).

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of records from AIC and NJIC collected by Homer J. Hall. Materials include: correspondence and meeting minutes from the national AIC Board of Directors and the NJIC Council; minutes and materials relating to the annual meetings of the Executive and Financial Committees of AIC; copies of The Chemist newsletter and the ACS Chemical Engineering News magazine; materials relating to the history of AIC and NJIC. The collection also contains a small amount of material relating to the AAAS, including AAAS handbooks, correspondence, and meeting information.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
